Build 20020409

I don't get a CVS folder in my file system when I checkout the CVSROOT folder 
from a CVS respository.

After changing the modules file and trying to commit it to the repository I got 
the following exception

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteLocation
(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.team.ccvs.core.CVSTeamProvider.checkin
(CVSTeamProvider.java:306)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RepositoryManager.commit
(RepositoryManager.java:631)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.actions.CommitAction$1.execute
(CommitAction.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run
(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1343)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run
(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)

Did you check out the project in the normal way (i.e. select in repo view and 
checkout) or were there special circumstances (i.e. project existsed before, 
etc.). Also, were there any log messages for the checkout?

I checked it out the normal way (e.g. from the CVS respository view) and the 
project didn't exist in my workspace before. I didn't see any log messages

I've found a problem with our new cancel code, do you remember ever cancelling a
CVS operation (e.g check out) before checking out CVSROOT?
Yes I canceled a previous check out.

Fixed.

There was a serious bug in EclipseSynchronizer::endOperation(). There was no
finally block to catch cancelled exceptions and decrement the CVS operation
nestingcount. Thus CVS sync information was not being persisted to disk for this
and any subsequant CVS operation.
